Description: MASSACHUSETTS MANUFACTURING EXTENSION PARTNERSHIP

PURPOSE: THE AWARD RECIPIENT WOULD BE GRANTED FUNDING THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO OPERATE A HOLLINGS MANUFACTURING EXTENSION PARTNERSHIP (MEP) CENTER IN THE STATE OF ARIZONA.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF ARIZONA.  THE PROPOSED MISSION OF THE RECIPIENT IS TO MAKE EVERY ARIZONA MANUFACTURER THE MOST SUCCESSFUL BUSINESS IT CAN BE.  THE UNDERLYING PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT STATE AND NATIONAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT GOALS BY STRENGTHENING DOMESTIC MANUFACTURING, EXPANDING AND STRENGTHENING THE ARIZONA MANUFACTURING ECOSYSTEM, SUPPORTING REGIONAL AND NATIONAL COLLABORATION, DEPLOYING ADVANCED MANUFACTURING TECHNOLOGIES, AND BUILDING A SKILLED AND RESILIENT WORKFORCE. ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT WOULD DELIVER WORLD-CLASS SERVICES TO ARIZONA'S MANUFACTURERS TO HELP THEM ACHIEVE THEIR BUSINESS AND OPERATIONAL GOALS. THE TEAM WILL ALSO ENGAGE WITH EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS (UNIVERSITY, COMMUNITY COLLEGE, TECHNICAL SCHOOLS), INDUSTRY TRADE ASSOCIATIONS, CHAMBERS OF COMMERCE, CITY/COUNTY/STATE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT GROUPS, AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES TO FURTHER STRENGTHEN ARIZONA'S MANUFACTURING ECOSYSTEM. SPECIAL ATTENTION WILL BE PAID TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ADVANCED MANUFACTURING TECHNOLOGIES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF A SKILLED WORKFORCE BY BUILDING AWARENESS OF MANUFACTURING CAREER CHOICES AND SUPPORTING THE COORDINATION OF EMPLOYER NEEDS WITH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. OUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVE OF THE MEP PROGRAM IS TO ENHANCE COMPETITIVENESS, PRODUCTIVITY, AND TECHNOLOGICAL PERFORMANCE IN UNITED STATES MANUFACTURING. THE RECIPIENT WOULD CONTINUE TO DEEPEN ITS MARKET PENETRATION AND WILL SERVE AT LEAST 110 CLIENTS IN FISCAL YEAR 2024, INCLUDING AT LEAST 54 NEW CLIENTS, AND WILL GROW THE CLIENT BASE BY AT LEAST 5 PERCENT PER YEAR. IT IS EXPECTED THAT SERVICE DELIVERY WILL BE APPROXIMATELY SPLIT EVENLY WITH 50 PERCENT FOCUSED ON TOP-LINE GROWTH AND 50 PERCENT FOCUSED ON BOTTOM LINE PERFORMANCE, ALTHOUGH THE ACTUAL SPLIT WILL DEPEND ON CLIENT DEMAND FOR DIFFERENT TYPES OF SERVICES. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT RECIPIENT WOULD CONTINUE TO ACHIEVE SCORES OF 90 TO 100 PERCENT ON CLIENT SURVEYS OVER THE NEXT FIVE YEARS. BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES WOULD BE THE SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS THAT UTILIZE THE SERVICES OF THE MEP CENTER IN ARIZONA, AND THE BENEFITS DERIVED WILL BE INCREASED REVENUE, REDUCED COSTS, IMPROVED PROFITABILITY, AND MORE EFFICIENT OPERATIONS. SECONDARY BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE LARGE MANUFACTURERS THAT RELY ON THE SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED COMPANIES AS PART OF THEIR SUPPLY CHAINS; ARIZONA CITIZENS WHO BENEFIT FROM THE TAX REVENUE GENERATED BY MANUFACTURERS THAT ARE MORE SUCCESSFUL; AND ARIZONA'S LABOR FORCE, WHICH BENEFITS FROM PLENTIFUL, HIGHER PAYING MANUFACTURING JOBS. INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES EXTEND BEYOND ARIZONA, AS THE CENTER WILL BECOME PART OF THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK, WHICH INCLUDES 51 MEP CENTERS LOCATED IN EACH STATE AND IN PUERTO RICO. SUBRECIPIENTS: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT PROPOSE TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE AWARD RECIPIENT WOULD BE GRANTED FUNDING THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO OPERATE A HOLLINGS MANUFACTURING EXTENSION PARTNERSHIP (MEP) CENTER IN THE STATE OF MARYLAND.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF MARYLAND, WITH DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA INCLUDED. ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PROPOSES TO CONTINUE TO EXPAND, DEVELOP AND DELIVER PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT SUPPORT MANUFACTURERS TODAY, WHILE IDENTIFYING NEW TECHNOLOGIES, NEW OPPORTUNITIES AND NEW PROCESSES THAT WILL POWER MANUFACTURING INTO TOMORROW. THIS INCLUDES INCREASING MARKET PENETRATION AND IMPACTS IN MARYLAND WHILE CREATING A PRESENCE IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.THE RECIPIENT PROPOSES TO ACCOMPLISH THE ABOVE OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE STRATEGY TO DELIVER THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:O	RAISE MARKET AND INDUSTRY AWARENESSO	CONDUCT OUTREACHO	ENGAGE INDUSTRY AND SOLICIT INPUT AND FEEDBACKO	PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS AND EVENTSO	DELIVER TECHNICAL, FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC ASSISTANCEO	ENSURE PERFORMANCE AND ACCOUNTABILITYO	CREATE NEW INDUSTRY AND STAKEHOLDER PARTNERSHIPSOUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVE OF THE MEP PROGRAM IS TO ENHANCE COMPETITIVENESS, PRODUCTIVITY, AND TECHNOLOGICAL PERFORMANCE IN UNITED STATES MANUFACTURING.  THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES ARE EXPECTED TO RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:O	INCREASE THE LEVEL OF AWARENESS OF MANUFACTURING IN MARYLAND AND DISTRICT OF COLUMBIAO	CONDUCT OUTREACH TO AT LEAST 60% OF THE MANUFACTURING BASE (~2,400 MANUFACTURERS)O	ENGAGE AT LEAST 30% OF THE MANUFACTURING BASE (~1,200 MANUFACTURERS)O	DELIVER PROJECTS WITH AT LEAST 150 MANUFACTURERS ON AN ANNUAL BASISO	CREATE AT LEAST $2BILLION IN ECONOMIC IMPACT (AS MEASURED BY THE NIST MEP CLIENT SURVEY)O	10,000 JOBS CREATED OR RETAINEDBENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN MARYLAND AND DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.  IN MARYLAND, THE BENEFICIARIES OF THESE PROPOSED SERVICES WOULD BE THE 4,000+ MANUFACTURERS THAT ARE PROUD TO MAKE IT IN MARYLAND AND THE NEARLY 200 MANUFACTURERS LOCATED IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA. INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES EXTEND BEYOND MARYLAND, AS THE CENTER WILL BECOME PART OF THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK?, WHICH INCLUDES 51 MEP CENTERS LOCATED IN EACH STATE AND IN PUERTO RICO.SUBRECIPIENTS: THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROGRAM WOULD BE DELIVERED BY THE RECIPIENT. HOWEVER, THE RECIPIENT PROPOSES TO ENGAGE THE FOLLOWING SUB-RECIPIENTS TO ASSIST WITH OUTREACH, EVENTS, AND PROGRAMMATIC SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE OVERALL MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION.O	SUBAWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,000 TO REGIONAL MANUFACTURING INSTITUTE TO BE THE PRIMARY OUTREACH AND AWARENESS PROVIDER FOR THE RECIPIENT, CONDUCTING EVENTS AND CO-HOSTING OUTREACH.O	SUBAWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $20,000 TO MARYLAND WORLD CLASS CONSORTIA. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR A RESOURCE AT MWCC TO CONDUCT OUTREACH ACTIVITIES, FOCUS ON DEVELOPING CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT SERVICES, PROVIDE PROCESS IMPROVEMENT TRAINING AND SERVICES AND FACILITATE THE LEAN PEER GROUPS.O	THE RECIPIENT EXPECTS TO ENGAGE ONE ADDITIONAL SUBRECIPIENT, AND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $20,000.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF NEBRASKA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE EXPANSION PROJECT WILL HIRE A DEDICATED FTE (FULL TIME EQUIVALENT) DEDICATED TO GROW THE CENTER SERVICES RELATED TO SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION, AND NEW SUPPLIER IDENTIFICATION. NEBRASKA MEP PROPOSES IMPLEMENTING AND SPONSORING A SUPPLY CHAIN DATABASE TO CONNECT MANUFACTURERS TO NEW VENDOR SOURCES AND ADDITIONAL CLIENT RELATIONSHIPS AND PARTNER WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN NEBRASKA TO CONNECT MANUFACTURERS TO SUPPLIERS.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASE CLIENT AND PROJECT COUNT, COST SAVINGS FOR CLIENTS AS WELL AS INCREASED SALES AS THE MAJOR CONSTRAINT ON SHIPPING RIGHT NOW IS COMPONENT AVAILABILITY FOR MOST OF OUR CLIENTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF NEBRASKA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF WYOMING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES IN WYOMING'S SUPPLY CHAIN, MW PROPOSES A 3-PHASED APPROACH FOCUSED ON THOROUGHLY UNDERSTANDING WYOMING'S LOCAL SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM, CREATING A WORKING GROUP OF REGIONAL MEP CENTERS TO FOCUS ON REGIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES, AND DEPLOYING SOLUTIONS AS A REGION WITH A STREAMLINED REGIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN STRATEGY.  LARGELY FOCUS ON, BUT NOT LIMIT TO, CRITICAL MANUFACTURING INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS IN THE AREAS OF EMERGING TECHNOLOGY, ENERGY, AND DEFENSE INDUSTRIAL BASE.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE US NEEDS BETTER TOOLS AND A UNIFIED SYSTEM FOR COLLABORATION TO BUILD SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCE AND INCREASE DOMESTIC SOURCING, LOCALLY, REGIONALLY, AND NATIONALLY, AND THIS APPROACH WILL LEAD TO A MORE EFFICIENT, EFFECTIVE, AND LONG-TERM RESILIENT REGIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN THAT BENEFITS ALL STAKEHOLDERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF WYOMING.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK¿ IN THE STATE OF UTAH.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UTAH¿S COMPLEX SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM IS CONCENTRATED IN A REASONABLY SMALL AREA. HOWEVER, THE BUYERS AND SUPPLIERS CAN BE BLOCKS AWAY AND STILL NOT FIND EACH OTHER. THE UTAH-MEP ALLIANCE (UTAH-MEP) HAS WORKED TO IMPLEMENT A SUPPLY CHAIN DATABASE FOR YEARS, IMPROVING MANUFACTURER CONNECTIONS. THE STATE'S PORTAL TO THE PLATFORM CAN BE FOUND ON THE UTAH-MEP, WHICH INCLUDES A VIDEO OF THE CURRENT GOVERNOR DECLARING CONNEX¿ UTAH TO BE THE SUPPLY CHAIN DATABASE OF UTAH. THE INTELLIGENCE NETWORK EXPANSION AWARD WILL LEVERAGE THIS SUCCESS BY ADDING NEEDED RESOURCES TO THE PROGRAM, INCLUDING ADDITIONAL OUTREACH, FOLLOW-UP ON EXCHANGE CENTER CONNECTIONS, AND FULL SUPPORT FOR MEP¿S SUPPLIER SCOUTING PROGRAM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THESE OUTCOMES WILL BE VERIFIED BY MEASURING OUTREACH EVENTS, PERFORMING COACHING SESSIONS, TRACKING EXCHANGE CENTER MATCHES, FOLLOWING THE IMPACT OF POS RECEIVED, AND RESPONDING TO SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF UTAH.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO PARTICIPATE IN CONDUCTING THE ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT AS STATED ABOVE.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: EXECUTION OF NEW MEXICO MEP'S PROJECT PLAN AIMS TO ENHANCE THE RESILIENCY OF THE NEW MEXICO MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM THROUGH VARIOUS ACTIVITIES. A SUPPLY CHAIN SPECIALIST WILL BE RECRUITED TO SERVE AS A FOCAL POINT FOR SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND SUPPORT, RESPONDING TO ALL INCOMING SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS TO SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF NEW MEXICO MANUFACTURERS. THE TEAM WILL EVALUATE EXISTING DATABASE/SYSTEMS TO COLLECT AND MANAGE SUPPLIER SCOUTING DATA AND SUPPLY CHAIN MAPPING INFORMATION. A SUPPLY CHAIN NEEDS ANALYSIS FOR NEW MEXICO MANUFACTURERS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO IDENTIFY STRENGTHS, GAPS, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR OPTIMIZATION, WITH ENHANCEMENTS TO CURRENT SUPPLY CHAIN PRODUCT OFFERINGS AND TRAIN-THE-TRAINER SUPPORT.  TO SUPPORT NEW MEXICO MEP'S EFFORTS WITH THIS PROJECT, THE CENTER WILL CONTRACT WITH FACULTY LED STUDENT GROUPS FROM THE BUSINESS SCHOOL AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO. THIS CONTRACT WILL UTILIZE BOSTON ANALYTICS ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TOOLS TO INVESTIGATE AND PROVIDE DATA ANALYTICS ON NEW MEXICO MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAIN INVOLVEMENT, RELATED INVESTMENTS AND RELATED STATISTICS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES AND IMPACTS WILL INCLUDE A MORE ROBUST AND RESILIENT SUPPLY CHAIN NETWORK, WITH MANUFACTURERS HAVING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF HOW TO EFFECTIVELY PLAN AND MANAGE THEIR SUPPLY CHAIN TO ENSURE PRODUCTS ARE PRODUCED AND DELIVERED ON SCHEDULE. THE ENHANCED PROCESSES AND DATABASE WILL PROVIDE A SOLID FOUNDATION FOR ALTERNATIVE SOURCING OPTIONS AND CREATE RELIABLE AND REPEATABLE SYSTEMS. THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT THE NEW MEXICO   MANUFACTURING ECOSYSTEM AND THE BROADER US MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAIN.  THE RESULTS AND DELIVERABLES FROM THIS WORK WILL HELP TO GUIDE THE MAPPING OF SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEMS THROUGHOUT NEW MEXICO.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF TEXAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TMAC WILL DEVELOP A STRATEGIC APPROACH TO IDENTIFY AND PROVIDE A LIST OF SEMICONDUCTOR RELATED COMPANIES, INITIALLY BY NAICS CODE, TO SUSTAINMENT WHO WILL THEN POPULATE THAT INFORMATION INTO THE TEXAS MANUFACTURING NETWORK PLATFORM. LEVERAGE INFORMATIONAL WEBINARS, OUTREACH TO OUR EXISTING NETWORK CHANNEL PARTNERS AND MANUFACTURING ASSOCIATIONS ACROSS THE STATE TO EDUCATE MANUFACTURERS AND ENCOURAGE THEM TO SECURE THEIR COMPANY PROFILE ON THE (TMN) PLATFORM. TMAC PLANS TO CONTINUE THE PARTNERSHIP WITH SUSTAINMENT TO LEVERAGE THEIR TECHNOLOGIES AND SUPPORT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE VERIFIED SUPPLIER PROGRAM, WHICH CO-OPS OUR TEAM'S EXPERTISE TO VALIDATE THE INFORMATION PROVIDED WITHIN TEXAS COMPANY PROFILES. WORK WITH SUSTAINMENT TO INCORPORATE THE MEP SUPPLIER SCOUTING PROGRAM INTO THE (TMN) PLATFORM WITH PLANS OF CONNECTING TO THE NATIONAL NETWORK TO ENHANCE ITS EFFECTIVENESS AND STREAMLINE THE PROCESS. THE GENERAL CONCEPT IS TO PROVIDE MEPS WITH A NO-COST BLUEPRINT ACCOUNT THUS PROVIDING THEM WITH THE ABILITY TO DIRECTLY ENTER REQUESTS INTO THE PLATFORM SO THAT THEY ARE BOTH VISIBLE AND ACTIONABLE TO THE MANUFACTURING COMMUNITY AND TO OTHER MEPS, TO TRACK THE CONNECTIONS AND TRANSACTIONS THAT RESULT, AND MAINTAIN A REAL TIME, VIRTUAL RECORD OF EACH OPPORTUNITY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TMAC ANTICIPATES POPULATING THE TEXAS MANUFACTURING NETWORK WITH KNOWN SEMICONDUCTOR ASSOCIATED COMPANIES WITHIN THE TWO-YEAR PERIOD TMAC WILL TARGET 1,000 OF THE ESTIMATED 2,000 SEMICONDUCTOR RELATED COMPANIES FOR LOADING ONTO THE (TMN) SYSTEM AND RECRUIT A TARGETED 200 COMPANIES INTO ACTIVE PROFILE STATUS WITH NO-COST PORTAL ACCOUNTS OVER A TWO-YEAR PERIOD UNDER THE PROPOSED GRANT FUNDING.   SEMICONDUCTOR-RELATED COMPANY INFORMATION WILL BE COLLECTED AND HOUSED ON THE TEXAS MANUFACTURING NETWORK PLATFORM, WHICH WILL ALLOW USERS TO INTERACT AND SEE THE HEAT MAP FOR THE SEMICONDUCTOR ECOSYSTEM WITHIN THE STATE OF TEXAS. ONCE ON THE TEXAS MANUFACTURING NETWORK PLATFORM, COMPANIES WILL BE ABLE TO SEARCH BY INDUSTRY CRITERIA AND COMMUNICATE COMPANY NEEDS AND CAPABILITY, BOTH WITHIN THE STATE AND NATIONALLY, USING THEIR PORTAL ACCOUNT. THE ABILITY TO SEARCH THE NETWORK CAN BE PROVIDED TO ANY MANUFACTURING COMPANY WILLING TO TAKE ON A PORTAL ACCOUNT OR SUPPORT ORGANIZATION (I.E. MEPS) WILLING TO TAKE ON A NO-COST SUSTAINMENT BLUEPRINT ACCOUNT, THUS PROVIDING THE OPPORTUNITY FOR BOTH STATE AND NATIONAL ACCESS, AND THE ABILITY TO LINK WITH THE MEP NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN NETWORK. THE NETWORK COULD BE USED AS AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT TOOL FOR ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS THE GOVERNOR'S OFFICE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATIONS, TO HELP ENCOURAGE MANUFACTURING INVESTMENT IN THE SEMICONDUCTOR INDUSTRY IN THE STATE BY PLACING THE SEMICONDUCTOR ECOSYSTEMS AT THE FINGERTIPS OF THE USER, THUS PROVIDING THE ABILITY TO SHARE ECOSYSTEM INFORMATION WITH POTENTIAL INVESTORS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF TEXAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO PARTICIPATE IN CONDUCTING THE ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT AS STATED ABOVE.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF ARKANSAS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DIRECT HIRE FTE AND/OR THIRD-PARTY RESOURCES, AS WELL AS EXISTING CENTER AND AGENCY RESOURCES. IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY OF OUR LOCAL AND DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS AND TO BUILD CAPABILITIES IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION. ASSIST MANUFACTURERS ADDRESS SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS AND MITIGATE RISKS.  PROVIDE OTHER SUPPLY CHAIN SUPPORT ACTIVITIES.   RESPOND TO AND TRACK MEP SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS.  ASSIST OUR STATE MANUFACTURERS IN COLLABORATING WITH THE REGIONAL, STATE AND NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN NETWORK.   DIVERSIFY THEIR SUPPLIER BASE, ENHANCE SUPPLY CHAIN VISIBILITY.   DEVELOP STRONG RELATIONSHIPS WITH SUPPLIERS.   IDENTIFY AND INVEST IN TECHNOLOGY AND AUTOMATION.   MANAGE THEIR SUPPLY CHAIN RISKS.   SUPPORT STATE AND FEDERAL SUPPLIER SCOUTING AND MATCHMAKING, CONNECTING SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) TO THESE OPPORTUNITIES.  DEVELOP A MORE COHESIVE STATE SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM.   IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT A DEDICATED SUPPLY CHAIN VISIBILITY PLATFORM TO SERVE THE ECOSYSTEM.  DEVELOP A SUPPLY CHAIN ASSESSMENT AND SERVICES TO ADDRESS GAPS IDENTIFIED FROM THE ASSESSMENT.  EMPLOY A MULTI-FACETED APPROACH TO INCREASE CENTER AWARENESS OF THE CURRENT SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM IN THE STATE, AS WELL AS INCREASE MARKET AWARENESS OF EXISTING SUPPLY CHAIN RESOURCES AND CENTER CAPABILITIES AVAILABLE TO THEM.    EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INCREASED AWARENESS OF SUPPLY CHAIN RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THEM; A COHESIVE SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM IS ESTABLISHED FOR THE STATE THAT ALSO SUPPORTS THE NATIONAL ECOSYSTEM; A SUPPLY CHAIN VISIBILITY PLATFORM IS IDENTIFIED AND IMPLEMENTED; KEY OEMS ARE IDENTIFIED, AS WELL AS SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS; A ROBUST SUPPLY CHAIN ASSESSMENT IS DEVELOPED; AND A ROBUST SUITE OF SERVICES ARE IDENTIFIED AND DEVELOPED TO ADDRESS SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS AND HELP ARKANSAS MANUFACTURERS IMPROVE THEIR COMPETITIVENESS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF ARKANSAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO PARTICIPATE IN CONDUCTING THE ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT AS STATED ABOVE.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN PUERTO RICO.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SEVEN (7) MAJOR ACTIVITIES WILL BE ADDRESSED. IDENTIFY- ASSIGNED FTE STAFF TO FOCUS ON SUPPLY CHAIN ACTIVITIES: FORMALIZE OUR SUPPLIER SCOUTING EFFORTS AND BUILDING INTERNAL CAPABILITIES WITH DEDICATED STAFF TO MANAGE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THIS TEAM WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR NATIONAL SUPPLIER SCOUTING AND OPTIMIZATION SERVICES TO ENSURE SCOUTING REQUEST ARE RESPONDED EVEN WHEN NO SUPPLIERS ARE IDENTIFIED, OVERSEE SUPPLY CHAIN PARTNERSHIPS, AND REPRESENT PRIMEX AS THE LEAD POINT OF CONTACT WITH THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK. PRIMEX SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY ASSESSMENTS TO IDENTIFY GAPS IN SUPPLY CHAIN OF TARGETED SECTORS - SMALL/MEDIUM/LARGE MANUFACTURERS, VERSUS OEM'S NEEDS AND OPPORTUNITIES. ENHANCE UNDERSTANDING (INTELLIGENCE) OF OUR CURRENT SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM AND CONNECT TO THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COMMUNITY REPRESENTED BY PUERTO RICO MANUFACTURE ASSOCIATION AND PUERTO RICO DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT & COMMERCE AMONG OTHERS. MAP THE SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEM & TO ASSESS AND ANALYZE SUPPLY CHAIN CAPABILITIES, CAPACITY, AND GAPS TO UNCOVER OPPORTUNITIES THAT BENEFITS LOCAL SUPPLY CHAIN NETWORKS AND PROVIDE RE-SHORING OPPORTUNITIES. CONDUCT SUPPLY CHAIN CAPABILITY RESEARCH STUDY TO UNCOVER LOCAL PRODUCTS FOR A MORE RESILIENCE LOCAL SUPPLY IN MINIMIZING PRODUCTS IMPORTS. PROVIDE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY OUTREACH EVENTS (COHORT) TO AUGMENT SUPPLY CHAIN ACTIVITIES AND AWARENESS. PRIMEX TO ENGAGE IN EXTENSIVE OUTREACH TO DETERMINE AND IDENTIFY MATCHES IN PUERTO RICO. SELECT, POPULATE, AND ACTIVELY MANAGE A SUPPLY CHAIN DATABASE TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE SUPPLIER CAPABILITY AND CAPACITY DATA. DATABASE TO BE SHARED WITH NATIONAL NETWORK. TRACK AND REPORT SUPPLY CHAIN ACTIVITIES, INSIGHTS, OUTPUTS, AND OUTCOMES- RECORDKEEPING, SERVICES, AND MATCHES. PRIMEX WILL USE SALESFORCE AND OTHER CRM PLATFORMS TO TRACK AND REPORT USING PREDEFINED METRICS AND DASHBOARDS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: AS A RESULT OF THIS FUNDING, PRIMEX WILL STRENGTHEN ITS INTERNAL PERSONNEL KNOWLEDGE TO SUPPORT THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK?S NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND INTELLIGENCE NETWORK, INCLUDING TIMELY PROCESSING OF ALL SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT, PRIMEX WILL BETTER UNDERSTAND THE STRENGTH AND NEEDS OF OUR SUPPLY CHAIN. THIS WILL ALLOW OUR PARTNERS TO INCLUDE SUPPLY CHAIN AS A KEY ELEMENT OF THE ISLAND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY. IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR INCREASED AWARENESS TO MANUFACTURERS AND OEM?S OF THE RELEVANCE AND UTILITY OF THE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND INTELLIGENCE NETWORK. FOR PRIMEX PERSONNEL IT WILL ALSO BE A LEARNING EXPERIENCE THROUGH DATA SHARING, DISSEMINATION, AND CAPACITY BUILDING ACTIVITIES OF THE NETWORK. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN PUERTO RICO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF DELAWARE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS EXPANSION PROJECT WILL HAVE AN FTE DEDICATED STAFFING TO PROVIDE OUTREACH AND COORDINATION OF DATA COLLECTION. UTILIZING A CONNECTION PLATFORM, STAFF WILL RECRUIT MANUFACTURERS TO REGISTER CAPABILITY AND CAPACITY INTELLIGENCE INTO THE PLATFORM TO PROVIDE AN IMPROVED PICTURE OF SUPPLY CHAIN RESOURCES THROUGHOUT THE STATE. IDENTIFY AND SUBSCRIBE TO A CONNECTION PLATFORM.  PREPARE THE PLATFORM FOR USE BY DELAWARE MANUFACTURERS. DEVELOP OUTREACH STRATEGY/IMPLEMENTATION PLAN.  MEMBER TRAINING AND ACCOUNT SETUP.  ONGOING MAINTENANCE OF THE PLATFORM.  ENGAGE MANUFACTURERS ON QUALITATIVE CHALLENGE DISCUSSIONS.   ASSESSMENT OF COLLECTED SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE DATA.  DOCUMENTATION AND SHARING OF INTELLIGENCE. WORKING WITH OTHER MEP CENTERS AND SUSTAINMENT TO DEVELOP A MEP CENTER DASHBOARD AND COMMUNITY ON SUSTAINMENT TO COLLECT, ANALYZE, AND TRACK SUPPLY CHAIN DATA AND METRICS ON A STATE, REGIONAL, AND NATIONAL BASIS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, MANUFACTURERS WITH ACTIVE ACCOUNTS, PROCUREMENT OPPORTUNITIES, BIDS MADE, CONTRACTS AWARDED, MATCHES, INTRODUCTIONS, AND ECONOMIC IMPACTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPAND THE CAPABILITIES AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR COLORADO MANUFACTURERS AND GENERATE ECONOMIC IMPACT BY INCREASING THE SEARCH AND PROCUREMENT OPPORTUNITIES ON SUSTAINMENT, ENSURING 100% RESPONSE ON SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS, INCREASING SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS, MAPPING AND ANALYZING THE AEROSPACE AND SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAIN, AND EXPANDING AND OPTIMIZING MANUFACTURER'S EDGE SUPPLIER SERVICES TO INCREASE DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY.  CONTRACTORS: MANUFACTURER'S EDGE UTILIZES A CONSULTANT WITH OVER 15 YEARS OF GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN EXPERIENCE IN THE INDUSTRIAL MANUFACTURING AND SERVICE INDUSTRIES AS A CONTRACTOR TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO COLORADO COMPANIES. THE CONTRACTOR WILL WORK WITH MIDDLE-MARKET MANUFACTURERS TO REDUCE THE COST, RISK, AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OF THEIR SUPPLY CHAINS; ESPECIALLY THOSE PREPARING FOR OR EXPERIENCING PERIODS OF EXTREME GROWTH. MANUFACTURER'S EDGE WILL ENGAGE THIS SUBJECT MATTER EXPERT TO ASSIST IN END-TO-END SUPPLY CHAIN MAPPING, PROVIDE SUPPLY CHAIN RISK ANALYSIS, AND ASSIST IN DEVELOPING PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS THAT WILL MITIGATE THE OVERALL SUPPLY CHAIN RISK FOR THE INDUSTRY STARTING WITH AEROSPACE AND SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF COLORADO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF ALASKA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ALASKA MEP WILL HIRE A FULL-TIME STAFF TO FACILITATE ENGAGEMENT IN THE SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND INTELLIGENCE NETWORK, ENABLING THE CENTER TO EXPAND PARTICIPATION IN THE SUPPLIER SCOUTING NETWORK WITHIN ALASKA. THIS NEW STAFF WILL MANAGE AND PARTICIPATE IN RESEARCH ON SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS, OPPORTUNITIES, AND MANUFACTURING CAPABILITIES IN-STATE AND GENERATE WRITTEN REPORTS AND DATA FOR NIST MEP. LASTLY, THE PROGRAM WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE BUY ALASKA PROGRAM TO ENSURE ALASKA MANUFACTURERS AND BUSINESSES UTILIZE ALL AVAILABLE RESOURCES TO MEET THEIR SUPPLY CHAIN NEEDS AND INCREASE SALES RELATED TO FILLING CRUCIAL SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE PROJECT'S LONG-TERM OUTCOME IS A MORE INTEGRATED IN-STATE ALASKA SUPPLY CHAIN THAT IS ALSO WELL CONNECTED TO THE NEEDS OF LOWER 48 COMPANIES. ONE CRITICAL OUTCOME OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE A REPORT THAT INCLUDES DATA ON ALASKA MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAIN-RELATED NEEDS AND CAPABILITIES ALONG WITH AN OUTLINE OF BEST PRACTICES AND LESSONS LEARNED BY THE ALASKA MEP. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BE ABLE TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES FOR KANSAS MANUFACTURERS TO SUPPORT NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN NEEDS INDIVIDUALLY AND COLLECTIVELY. UNDERSTAND AND DOCUMENT THE STRENGTHS OF AND GAPS IN THE KANSAS SUPPLY CHAIN. IT WILL ALSO BENEFIT KANSAS ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT MANUFACTURERS (OEMS) AND TIER 1 SUPPLIERS THROUGH IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE AND VISIBILITY TO MANUFACTURING CAPABILITIES WITHIN THE STATE. KANSAS SMMS WILL ALSO BE SERVED AS SUPPLIER OPTIONS ARE MORE VISIBLE AND BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES ARISE AS LARGER MANUFACTURERS SEEK TO LOCALIZE AND DIVERSIFY THEIR SUPPLY CHAINS.  THE KANSAS SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE GAINED THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL HELP STATE PARTNERS AS THEY CRAFT AND EXECUTE A STATEWIDE MANUFACTURING STRATEGY. IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF NEVADA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE MAJOR ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE 1) RESPONDING TO ALL SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS, 2) CREATING AWARENESS OF SUPPLIER SCOUTING AND SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION SERVICES AVAILABLE THROUGH OUR CENTER AND ACROSS THE MEP NETWORK, 3) RECRUITING OEM AND SMM PARTICIPATION IN SUPPLIER SCOUTING, RESILIENCE, AND OPTIMIZATION INITIATIVES, 4) GATHERING AND ANALYZING SUPPLIER CAPABILITY AND CAPACITY DATA TO MAP LOCAL SUPPLY NETWORK ECOSYSTEMS, 5) IDENTIFYING OEM SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS AND HELP TO FILL THOSE GAPS BY CONNECTING SMMS TO THESE OPPORTUNITIES, 6) IDENTIFYING NEW SERVICE OFFERINGS TO AUGMENT AND OPTIMIZE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCE, AND 7) TRACKING, MEASURING, AND REPORTING SMM SUPPLIER SCOUTING INTRODUCTIONS, MATCHES, AND SUPPLY CHAIN PROJECTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT IS ANTICIPATED TO RESULT IN OUTREACH TO ALL OEMS IN NEVADA AND TO GENERATE AN AVERAGE OF 10 SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS OVER THE COURSE OF TWO YEARS. THIS PROJECT ANTICIPATES RECRUITING AT LEAST 100 SMMS TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS PROJECT BY PROVIDING DETAILED INFORMATION OF THEIR MANUFACTURING EXPERTISE, CAPABILITIES, AND CAPACITY. THIS PROJECT ANTICIPATES THE INCLUSION OF AVAILABLE LIMITED SUPPLIER DATA FROM OTHER SMMS. THIS PROJECT IS ANTICIPATED TO DEVELOP UP TO TWO NEW SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCE SERVICE OFFERINGS, ONE PER YEAR, BASED UPON FEEDBACK FROM PARTICIPATING OEMS AND SMMS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF NEVADA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF MARYLAND.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE MARYLAND MEP TEAM WILL ACCOMPLISH THESE OBJECTIVES THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE STRATEGY TO DELIVER THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: IMPLEMENT A STATE-WIDE MANUFACTURING DATABASE WITH ACCESS AND LINKAGES TO A NATIONAL MANUFACTURING AND SUPPLIER DATABASE; IMPROVE MARKET UNDERSTANDING OF THE NEARLY 3,000 MARYLAND MANUFACTURERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND CAPABILITIES, PROCESSES, INDUSTRY SECTORS, CAPACITY, AND OTHER KEY DRIVERS; PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR IMPROVED SUPPLIER CONNECTIVITY, MATCHMAKING AND BUYING OPPORTUNITIES FOR MARYLAND MANUFACTURERS, OEMS, AND SUPPLIERS; DEDICATE PERSONNEL AND RESOURCES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE MARYLAND SUPPLY BASE, RESPOND TO NATIONAL SUPPLIER SCOUTING OPPORTUNITIES AND SUPPORT THE MANUFACTURING ECOSYSTEM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF THE EFFORT PROPOSED WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWINGOUTCOMES: IMPLEMENTATION OF A STATE-WIDE MANUFACTURING DATABASE WITH LINKAGES TO REGIONAL AND NATIONAL PLATFORMS; LIST AT LEAST 1,200 MANUFACTURERS / SUPPLIERS IN THE DATABASE IN YEAR 1 (~40%); INCREASE MANUFACTURER / SUPPLIER LISTINGS TO AT LEAST 2,000 MANUFACTURERS / SUPPLIERS IN YEAR 2 (~60%); SHARE AND RESPOND TO NATIONAL SUPPLIER SCOUTING OPPORTUNITIES WITH MARYLAND MANUFACTURING BASE; SHARE MONTHLY SUCCESS STORIES / CASE STUDIES (TO BEGIN 6 MONTHS AFTER AWARD); CONDUCT OUTREACH TO MARYLAND OEMS AND ENGAGE AT LEAST 6 TO PARTICIPATE IN MARKETPLACE; AND DEDICATE A RESOURCE TO EXPAND MARYLAND MEP'S SUPPLY CHAIN ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORT THE MANUFACTURING ECOSYSTEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF MARYLAND.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF VERMONT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: LAUNCH THE CONNEX'S SUPPLY CHAIN PLATFORM, PROJECT MANAGING THE IMPLEMENTATION, MARKETING THE PLATFORM AND ITS BENEFITS TO VERMONT MANUFACTURERS, IDENTIFYING THE TWO YEAR ROLL OUT SCHEDULE, ENGAGING RESOURCES EQUIVALENT TO AN FTE TO MANAGE THE ACTIVITIES, ONBOARDING VERMONT MANUFACTURERS ONTO THE PLATFORM AND DELIVERING A SUSTAINABLE ACTION PLAN RESULTING IN A VISIBLE, RESILIENT AND CONSTANTLY IMPROVING SUPPLY CHAIN BY THE GRANT END DATE.  VMEC PLANS TO CONTRACT INITIALLY WITH ONE FULL TIME AND SEVERAL PART TIME RESOURCES INCLUDING: A PROJECT/PROGRAM LEADER, SUPPORTING OUTREACH RESOURCES, AND TRAINERS TO RAMP UP EXISTING VMEC STAFF TO OPTIMIZE THE LAUNCH OF THE SUPPLY CHAIN SAAS PLATFORM THAT WILL ENABLE SPEEDY AND COMPREHENSIVE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY LOCALLY, REGIONALLY AND NATIONALLY. CONTRACTED SUPPORT THROUGH VERMONT STATE UNIVERSITY RESOURCES AND THIRD-PARTY SPECIALIZED SUPPORT IN PROJECT MANAGEMENT MAY ALSO BE USED TO ADD UP TO THE EQUIVALENT OF ONE FTE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CONTACT AND ENGAGE UP TO 50% OF THE VERMONT MANUFACTURING BASE BY THE END OF THE TWO-YEAR PERIOD AND TO ENROLL UP TO 50% AFTER A FOUR-YEAR PERIOD.  CONNECT VERMONT MANUFACTURERS, LOCALLY, REGIONALLY AND NATIONALLY AS PART OF A US WIDE RESILIENT SUPPLY CHAIN AND TO BE A CATALYST FOR LOCAL, REGIONAL AND NATIONAL SOURCING AS PART OF A HEALTHY DIVERSE AND VISIBLE US SUPPLY CHAIN NETWORK, LESSENING DEPENDENCE ON OVERSEAS SUPPLY CHAINS ESPECIALLY IN MATTERS OF NATIONAL DEFENSE. THE IMPACT FOR VERMONT MANUFACTURERS WILL BE TO BE PART OF A LOCAL, REGIONAL AND NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN MAKING VISIBLE CAPABILITIES, CAPACITY, ACCREDITATIONS, AND CERTIFICATIONS. THIS WILL GIVE VERMONT MANUFACTURERS MORE OPPORTUNITIES TO BOTH BUY AND SELL SUPPLIES AND FINISHED GOODS AS PART OF THE US SUPPLY CHAIN, DECREASING COSTS OF BUSINESS, LOGISTICAL DIFFICULTY, TIME TO SOURCE AND SELL AS WELL AS INCREASING SPEED TO FIND SUPPLIERS AND BUYERS BY BEING INVOLVED IN SIGNIFICANTLY MORE US BASED BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF VERMONT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GAMEP PROPOSES HIRING OR ALLOCATING ONE NEW FTE (FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT) FOR FULL-TIME MANAGEMENT OF MANUFACTURERS? SUPPLY CHAIN OPPORTUNITY REQUESTS FROM THE NATIONAL NETWORK AND FROM REQUESTS COMING DIRECTLY INTO GAMEP FROM THE STATE OF GEORGIA. THE FTE WILL BE THE MAIN CONTACT POINT WITHIN THE GAMEP FOR SUPPLY CHAIN REQUESTS AND WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR UTILIZING A COMBINATION OF SCOUTING SUBSCRIPTION DATABASES, OTHER WEB-BASED DATA SEARCH ENGINES, SUPPLIER SOURCING BEST PRACTICES, AND LEVERAGING THE EXPERTISE OF THE EXISTING SUPPLY CHAIN PRACTITIONERS (INCLUDING THE PROGRAM PI) ON STAFF TO FORMULATE A RESPONSE TO ALL REQUESTS. OVER THE COURSE OF THE TWO-YEAR PILOT, A SUMMARIZATION WILL BE DONE OF GAMEP'S UNDERSTANDING OF THE LOCAL SUPPLY CHAIN LANDSCAPE, GAPS THAT EXIST IN BUILDING OUT SUPPLY CHAIN CAPABILITIES AND CAPACITIES FOR MAJOR LOCAL OEM'S AND A BETTER MARKET UNDERSTANDING OF THE LOCAL SUPPLY CHAIN NETWORK. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE PILOT, LOCAL WILL BE DEFINED AS GEORGIA BUT MAY INCLUDE REGIONAL NETWORKS ACROSS STATE LINES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: GAMEP EXPECTS THAT THE PILOT FUNDING WILL JUMP START ITS ENTRY INTO SUPPLIER SCOUTING BY DEDICATING A RESOURCE THAT DOES NOT CURRENTLY EXIST, TO CONDUCT NEAR REAL-TIME SUPPLIER SCOUTING UTILIZING AVAILABLE DATABASE RESOURCES AND EXISTING STAFF EXPERTISE. THIS WILL PROVIDE THE GAMEP WITH CRITICAL KNOWLEDGE OF SUPPLY CHAINS WITHIN THE STATE AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT EXIST TO CONNECT. COLLECTED DATA FROM OPPORTUNITY REQUESTS AND RESPONSES WILL HELP INFORM GAMEP AND THE NATIONAL NETWORK OF THE AVAILABILITY AND CAPACITY OF LOCAL NETWORKS THAT CAN MEET SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS ACROSS THE SYSTEM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF VIRGINIA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THERE WILL BE THREE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES SUPPORTED BY THE FUNDING. FIRST, THE FUNDING WILL PROVIDE THE ABILITY TO HIRE A FULL-TIME CONNEX VIRGINIA MANAGER TO MANAGE AND FACILITATE THE USE OF THE CONNEX VIRGINIA MARKETPLACE. THIS WILL INCLUDE GROWING THE NUMBER OF COMPANIES USING THE TOOL AS WELL AS WORKING WITH THE REGISTERED MANUFACTURERS TO FACILITATE EXCHANGE POSTING AND SUPPLIER SCOUTING RESPONSES TO INCREASE SUPPLY CHAIN LINKAGES. SECONDLY, THE CONNEX VIRGINIA MARKETPLACE MANAGER (CVMM) WILL ALSO SUPPORT SUPPLY CHAIN MAPPING AND INTELLIGENCE EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY CRITICAL GAPS IN EXISTING CAPABILITIES THAT CAN BE TARGETED FOR SUPPLY CHAIN DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS. THE CVMM MANAGER WILL ALSO FACILITATE MATCHES TO IDENTIFIED NEEDS AS REQUESTED IN THE INTELLIGENCE NETWORK. LASTLY, THE FUNDING WILL PROVIDE CONTRACT RESOURCES TO GENERATE RELEVANT DIGITAL CONTENT THAT CAN BE USED TO DEVELOP EXISTING VIRGINIA MANUFACTURERS, ESPECIALLY SMALL SUPPLIERS, OR SUPPORT IDENTIFYING APPROPRIATE DOMESTIC SOURCES TO FILL CRITICAL SUPPLY CHAIN NEEDS FOR COMMONWEALTH BUSINESSES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PRIMARY IMPACT OF THE FUNDING WILL BE TO 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF SUPPLY CHAIN CONNECTIONS FOR AND BETWEEN VIRGINIA'S MANUFACTURERS BY IDENTIFYING OPPORTUNITIES TO BUILD NEW RELATIONSHIPS THAT STRENGTHEN THE SUPPLY CHAIN, 2) PROVIDE ALTERNATIVES TO REDUCE SUPPLIER RISK, AND 3) IMPROVE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCE WHILE ENSURING THAT ALL SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS RECEIVE AN EVALUATION AND RESPONSE. INCREASING ENGAGEMENT IN CONNEX VIRGINIA WILL PROVIDE DATA AND MARKET INTELLIGENCE TO HELP IDENTIFY CRITICAL OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE THE CAPACITY AND RESILIENCE OF LOCAL AND NATIONAL MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAINS. THIS FUNDING WILL PROVIDE CAPACITY TO DEVELOP RELEVANT DIGITAL CONTENT, TRAINING, AND RESOURCES TO HELP SMALL MANUFACTURERS DEVELOP CAPABILITIES NEEDED TO FILL CRITICAL SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS, OR TO AUGMENT EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS TO REDUCE SUPPLY RISK AND INCREASE THE RESILIENCE OF THE SUPPLY CHAIN. THIS WILL BENEFIT MANUFACTURERS IN VIRGINIA DIRECTLY BY INCREASING THEIR REVENUE, ESTABLISHING PROFITABLE SUPPLIER RELATIONSHIPS, AND IMPROVING CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE MORE VALUE TO THEIR CUSTOMERS. IN TURN, THIS WILL INCREASE THE RESILIENCE AND REDUCE THE LEVEL OF RISK IN CRITICAL SUPPLY CHAINS, THEREBY IMPROVING THE SECURITY OF THE COMMONWEALTH AND THE NATION, WHILE PROVIDING INTELLIGENCE AND INSIGHT INTO STRENGTHS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS (SMMS) IN THE STATE OF VIRGINIA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO EXPAND EXISTING MEP CAPABILITIES TO PROVIDE NATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND TO ESTABLISH A SUPPLY CHAIN INTELLIGENCE NETWORK.  IMPROVE THE RESILIENCY AND OPTIMIZATION FOR DOMESTIC SUPPLY CHAINS IN THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK IN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TMEP WILL DEDICATE A SUPPLIER SCOUTING TEAM MADE-UP OF THE EQUIVALENT OF ONE FULL TIME STAFF FOR A PERIOD OF TWO YEARS THAT WILL BE THE TMEP CENTER LEAD POINT(S) OF CONTACT RESPONSIBLE FOR BUILDING AND MAINTAINING THE SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION AND INTELLIGENCE NETWORK. THE TMEP SUPPLIER SCOUTING TEAM WILL: (1) ESTABLISH AND EXECUTE AN INTERNAL SYSTEM TO SUPPORT THE MEP SUPPLIER SCOUTING PROGRAM TO FACILITATE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN ENTITIES WITH A SPECIFIC SUPPLIER NEEDS AND TENNESSEE COMPANIES WITH THE CAPABILITY TO FULFILL THE NEEDS, AND ENSURE THAT ALL MEP SUPPLIER SCOUTING REQUESTS RECEIVE A RESPONSE, (2) WORK TO IDENTIFY, DOCUMENT CAPABILITIES, AND DOCUMENT THE SUPPLIER RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN COMPANIES WITHIN STRATEGIC INDUSTRIES (THE AUTOMOTIVE INDUSTRY) IN TENNESSEE, AND (3) AUTHOR A DETAILED PROJECT REPORT FOR BEST PRACTICES SHARING ACROSS THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK AND PARTICIPATION IN MEP SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION WORKING GROUP DISCUSSIONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN: INCREASED SUPPLIER CONNECTIONS BETWEEN COMPANIES THAT RESULT IN NEW OR RETAINED BUSINESS FOR EITHER PARTY; IDENTIFYING AND DOCUMENTING SMALL AND MID-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN TENNESSEE AND THEIR CAPABILITIES THAT CAN BE CONNECTED TO OTHER DOMESTIC COMPANIES THAT HAVE SUPPLY CHAIN NEEDS; IDENTIFYING AND DOCUMENTING THE COMPANIES IN THE AUTOMOTIVE INDUSTRY IN TENNESSEE AND THEIR CAPABILITIES, AND TO UNDERSTAND THEIR SITUATION AND PLANS RELATED TO THE TRANSITION FROM INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE (ICE) VEHICLES TO BATTERY ELECTRIC VEHICLES (BEV). CREATION AND EXPANSION OF SERVICES TO CLOSE THE GAP. INCREASED NUMBER OF SUPPLIER SCOUTING RESPONSES BY INDIANA'S SMMS. PURPOSE: THE AWARD RECIPIENT WOULD BE GRANTED FUNDING THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO OPERATE A HOLLINGS MANUFACTURING EXTENSION PARTNERSHIP (MEP) CENTER IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY.  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LEVELS, THE CENTER PLANS TO ENHANCE MANUFACTURING IN KENTUCKY BY FOCUSING ON BUSINESS GROWTH, EXPANSION, COMPETITIVENESS, AND SUSTAINABILITY OF SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS. THE CENTER WILL ADDRESS MANUFACTURING SUPPLY CHAIN AND TECHNOLOGY ADOPTION ISSUES IN KENTUCKY BY MAKING IT EASIER FOR MANUFACTURERS TO IMPLEMENT 21ST-CENTURY MANUFACTURING TECHNOLOGIES, TECHNIQUES, AND SOLUTIONS; ALIGNING RESOURCES TO INCREASE MARKET PENETRATION AND SUSTAINABLE MANUFACTURING; AND CULTIVATING A NETWORK OF SUPPLIERS IN KENTUCKY TO INCREASE SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCE AND QUICK ADOPTION OF MANUFACTURING SOLUTIONS. THE CENTER WILL ADDRESS MANUFACTURING WORKFORCE ISSUES WITH ITS SUBRECIPIENTS, LEVERAGING THEIR ACADEMIC RESOURCES AND SUPPORT TO BRING WORKFORCE SOLUTIONS TO SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVE OF THE MEP PROGRAM IS TO ENHANCE COMPETITIVENESS, PRODUCTIVITY, AND TECHNOLOGICAL PERFORMANCE IN UNITED STATES MANUFACTURING. THE CENTER WILL ENHANCE MANUFACTURING IN KENTUCKY BY EMPOWERING MANUFACTURERS TO IMPLEMENT NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND TO ALIGN RESOURCES THROUGH COALITIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS TO LEAD TO A MORE RESILIENT SUPPLY CHAIN, AND BY PROVIDING MANUFACTURERS WITH WORKFORCE AND OPERATIONAL SOLUTIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN KENTUCKY. INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES EXTEND BEYOND KENTUCKY, AS THE CENTER WILL BECOME PART OF THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK?, WHICH INCLUDES 51 MEP CENTERS LOCATED IN EACH STATE AND IN PUERTO RICO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO MURRAY STATE UNIVERSITY (WESTERN KENTUCKY) AND SOMERSET COMMUNITY COLLEGE (EASTERN KENTUCKY) TO INCREASE OUTREACH ACROSS THE STATE. THE SUBRECIPIENTS HAVE EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL AND REGIONAL SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS AND WILL LEVERAGE THE EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS TO PROMOTE THE CENTER?S ACTIVITIES AND CAPABILITIES. SOMERSET COMMUNITY COLLEGE WILL CO-DELIVER TRAINING TO MANUFACTURING EMPLOYEES, AND MURRAY STATE UNIVERSITY WILL CO-SPONSOR EXTENSION-RELATED ENGAGEMENTS.

PURPOSE: INITIALLY COMPETITIVELY REVIEWED IN 2017, THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FUNDED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO NORTH DAKOTA SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURES (SMM). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: IMPACT DAKOTA WILL EXPAND ITS SERVICE OFFERINGS ? BOTH WITH INTERNAL STAFF CAPABILITIES AND EXTERNAL THIRD PARTY CONTRACTORS ? TO BE ABLE TO FULFILL A MAJORITY OF MANUFACTURER?S NEEDS, REGARDLESS OF SIZE OR LOCATION.  NEW SERVICE DEVELOPMENT WILL ALSO INCLUDE THE MODE OF SERVICE DELIVERY.  WHENEVER POSSIBLE, PROGRAMMING WILL BE PROVIDED VIRTUALLY IN ORDER TO BE ABLE TO REACH MORE OF THE VERY SMALL AND RURAL BUSINESSES.  EXPANDED SERVICE PROGRAMMING WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE CENTER?S FOCUS ON MEETING NIST MEP METRICS REQUIREMENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPACT DAKOTA HAS LONG BEEN A LEADER IN LEAN MANUFACTURING TRAINING AND IMPLEMENTATION, AND WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF BUSINESS IN THIS AREA.  HOWEVER, BUSINESSES HAVE IDENTIFIED AREAS OF CRITICAL NEEDS THAT IMPACT DAKOTA WILL WORK WITH OTHER ENTITIES IN ORDER TO HELP SMMS ADDRESS THESE NEEDS.  THESE AREAS OF FOCUS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: WORKFORCE ATTRACTION, DEVELOPMENT AND RETENTION; SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION; CYBERSECURITY PROTECTION; INDUSTRY 4.0 / AUTOMATION; ORGANIZATIONAL CULTURE.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NORTH DAKOTA SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS AND THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK.

PURPOSE: INITIALLY COMPETITIVELY REVIEWED IN 2017, THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FUNDED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO IOWA SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURES (SMM). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CIRAS COMBINES INTERNAL EXPERTISE WITH OUTSTANDING PARTNERS, DEEP RELATIONSHIPS WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS, AND STRONG AFFILIATE SERVICE PROVIDERS. THE IOWA MEP TEAM HAS DEPLOYED AND REFINED A PROVEN APPROACH TO UNDERSTANDING THE DIVERSE NEEDS OF IOWA MANUFACTURERS, DELIVERING SERVICES TO MEET THOSE NEEDS, AND ENSURING THAT PROGRAMS MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR STAKEHOLDERS. THE IOWA MEP STRATEGY CLOSELY ALIGNS WITH THE NIST MEP STRATEGY OF ENHANCING COMPETITIVENESS, CHAMPIONING MANUFACTURING, SUPPORTING PARTNERSHIPS, AND DEVELOPING CAPABILITIES ACROSS THE NATIONAL SYSTEM. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: CIRAS HAS LONG BEEN A LEADER MANUFACTURING TRAINING AND IMPLEMENTATION, AND WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF BUSINESS IN THIS AREA. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME FOR THIS AWARD IS TARGETED SMM OFFERINGS IN:- LEADERSHIP: STRATEGY, MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS; SUPPLY CHAIN; INNOVATION.- GROWTH: MARKET STRATEGY; EXPORTING; B2B NETWORKING.- PRODUCTIVITY: LEAN/IOWA LEAN CONSORTIUM; OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE; QUALITY.- TECHNOLOGY: INDUSTRY 4.0; AUTOMATION; ENGINEERING; TESTING- WORKFORCE: WORKFORCE STRATEGIES; STUDENT ENGAGEMENTINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: IOWA SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS AND THE MEP NATIONAL NETWORK.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NORTH IOWA AREA COMMUNITY COLLEGE'S (NIACC'S) JOHN PAPPA ENTREPRENEURIAL CENTER (JPEC) WAS SELECTED TO BE A PARTNER TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO SMALL AND START-UP MANUFACTURERS IN NORTH-CENTRAL IOWA.  NIACC PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN BUSINESS PLANNING, RAPID PROTOTYPING, AND HIGH-POTENTIAL CLIENT IDENTIFICATION. THE NIST MEP FUNDS ARE USED TO ASSESS THE BUSINESS NEEDS AND IDENTIFY THE APPROPRIATE RESOURCES TO ADDRESS THOSE NEEDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF MAINE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: MAINE MEP STRATEGICALLY PARTNERS WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS (I.E., DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, SOUTHERN MAINE COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY OF MAINE ADVANCED MTG. CENTER) THROUGHOUT THE STATE TO DELIVER VALUE-ADD SERVICES IN FOUR CORE AREAS (1) ENTERPRISE MANAGEMENT, (2) PERFORMANCE-BASED TRAINING, (3) SUPPLY CHAIN STRENGTHENING AND (4) INNOVATION SERVICES.     EXPECTED OUTCOMES: MAINE MEP?S GOAL ARE TO ENSURE PROFITABLE MANUFACTURING GROWTH THROUGH DELIVER CLIENT-CENTRIC SERVICES ALIGNED WITH SME GOALS TO ACHIEVE ECONOMIC IMPACT, BECOME A LEADING RESOURCE EXPERT OR/AND CHAMPION OF GROWTH AND INNOVATION FOR SMES IN MAINE, AND EXPAND AND DEEPENING PARTNERSHIPS WITHIN THE MANUFACTURING ECOSYSTEM THAT BENEFIT SMES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE MAINE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS FOR GENERAL BUSINESS ASSISTANCE SERVICES TO AREA MANUFACTURERS THROUGH A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE SMALL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CENTER, BUSINESS FINANCING ASSISTANCE, EXPORT ASSISTANCE AND TARGETED INDUSTRY ASSISTANCE, AND TO USE ITS BEST EFFORTS TO SUPPORT THE MAINE MEP MISSION TO ESTABLISH, PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, AND EXPAND A STATEWIDE MEP IDENTITY.BACKGROUND EFFECTIVE APRIL 2017, VIA COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE, MAINE MEP WAS GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE A MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF MAINE.  HOWEVER, AS REQUIRED BY THE MEP STATUE, SEC. 25 (G) ?EVALUATIONS? A SECRETARIAL REVIEW MUST BE CONDUCTED IN THE FIFTH YEAR OF OPERATION OF A CENTER. THIS EVALUATION DETERMINES IF A CENTER MAY CONTINUE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. MAINE MEP IS IN YEAR 5 OF THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THEREFORE, A SECRETARIAL REVIEW WAS CONDUCTED.  THE SECRETARIAL EVALUATION OF THE MAINE MEP WAS CONDUCTED ON DECEMBER 20, 2021 BY THE MEP DIRECTOR, THE DEPUTY DIRECTOR, THE DIVISION CHIEF FOR REGIONAL AND STATE PARTNERSHIPS, THE EXECUTIVE OFFICER, AND THE GROUP MANAGER FOR PROGRAM EVALUATION AND ECONOMIC RESEARCH.

PURPOSE:  EFFECTIVE APRIL 1, 2022, VIA THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THIS RECIPIENT WILL BE GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE AN MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF HAWAII. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO THE RAPIDLY GROWING SMALL AND MEDIUM MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF HAWAII. KEY INITIATIVES INCLUDE 1) ENHANCE COMPETITIVENESS OF HAWAII MANUFACTURERS THROUGH TRAINING AND SERVICES; 2) SUSTAIN AND GROW HAWAII MANUFACTURERS; 3) BUILD A SUPPORT ECOSYSTEM FOR MANUFACTURERS; AND 4) DEVELOP THE CAPABILITIES OF THE MEP CENTER. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS WITH THE HTDC (STATE), THE CENTER IS FOCUSING ON ESTABLISHING AND SUSTAINING A SKILLED WORKFORCE WHILE NAVIGATING THE STRUGGLES OF THE GEOGRAPHY OF HAWAII. THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL SUPPORT #1 INCLUDE GROWTH (E.G., EXPORT ASSISTANCE, BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT, AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT), EFFICIENCY (E.G., LEAN OPERATIONS, ENERGY EFFICIENCY, QUALITY, SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT, AND TECHNOLOGY INTEGRATION), ASSISTANCE FOR BUSINESSES WHICH LEVERAGE THE HAWAII BRAND OR HAVE SIGNIFICANT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY (E.G. HAWAII FOOD MANUFACTURERS, SBIR COMPANIES). #2 INCREASING PROGRAMS AVAILABLE FOR MANUFACTURERS AND ESTABLISHING INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT NEW MANUFACTURERS, SERVING AS A CHAMPION FOR MANUFACTURING AND PROMOTING THE ?MADE IN HAWAII? BRAND, MENTORING AND OUTREACH SUPPORT TO STRENGTHEN MANUFACTURING ON THE NEIGHBOR ISLANDS. #3 STRENGTHENING REGIONAL PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATING ON INITIATIVES, SHARED INFRASTRUCTURE, AND SUPPORT PROGRAMS FOR MANUFACTURERS, CONNECTING MANUFACTURERS, SUPPLIERS, AND DISTRIBUTORS, FACILITATING A PIPELINE OF SKILLED AND TALENTED MANUFACTURING WORKERS. AND #4 ADOPTING TRAINING PROVIDED BY NIST INTO INNOVATE HAWAII SERVICE OFFERINGS, LEARNING FROM OTHER MEP CENTERS AND STAYING CURRENT WITH RELEVANT FEDERAL PROGRAMS, GROWING OUR NETWORK OF PROVIDERS TO ADDRESS THE CHANGING NEEDS OF OUR CUSTOMERS, AND IMPROVING THE PROGRAM THROUGH CONTINUOUS REVIEWS AND UPDATES TO THE OPERATION PLAN.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INNOVATE HAWAII AIMS TO BE THE LEADING MANUFACTURING CONSULTING AND TRAINING ORGANIZATION IN HAWAII, AS WELL AS THE FACILITATOR THAT BUILDS RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN LOCAL AND U.S. MAINLAND SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONS TO BOLSTER HAWAII?S GROWING MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF HAWAII.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  EFFECTIVE APRIL 1, 2022 VIA THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THIS RECIPIENT WAS GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE AN MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF WYOMING. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF WYOMING. THESE THREE APPROACHES HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED BY THE CURRENT TEAM DURING THE PAST YEAR?S TRANSITION PERIOD. THE CENTER BUILDS AWARENESS OF MANUFACTURING CAREERS WITH THEIR PROGRAMS/PRESENTATIONS.  PROVIDE SERVICES THAT ADDRESS WORKFORCE BEHAVIORS THAT IMPACT PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PERFORMANCE ISSUES. THEIR LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT AND SUCCESSION PLAN DEVELOPMENT HELPS MANUFACTURERS CONTINUE TO GROW AND BE VIABLE. EFFECTIVE APRIL 1 2017, VIA COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE, NEVADA INDUSTRY EXCELLENCE WAS GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE A MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF NEVADA AS REQUIRED BY THE MEP STATUE, SEC. 25 (G) ?EVALUATIONS,? A SECRETARIAL REVIEW OF THE CENTER MUST BE CONDUCTED IN THE FIFTH YEAR. THIS EVALUATION DETERMINES IF A CENTER MAY CONTINUE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.  THE SECRETARIAL REVIEW OF NEVADA INDUSTRY EXCELLENCE WAS CONDUCTED ON DECEMBER 20, 2021 BY THE MEP DIRECTOR, THE DIVISION CHIEF FOR REGIONAL AND STATE PARTNERSHIPS, THE DIVISION CHIEF FOR FINANCE MANAGEMENT AND CENTER OPERATIONS, AND THE GROUP MANAGER FOR PROGRAM EVALUATION AND ECONOMIC RESEARCH.PROJECT DESCRIPTION:PURPOSE:  EFFECTIVE APRIL 1, 2022 VIA THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THIS RECIPIENT WILL BE GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE AN MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF NEVADA. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO THE RAPIDLY GROWING SMALL AND MEDIUM MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF NEVADA. KEY INITIATIVES INCLUDE 1) ACCELERATE AND INVIGORATE ITS CONVENING OF MANUFACTURERS FOR A COMMON VOICE; 2) ADOPT AND OFFER MORE RECOGNIZED CREDENTIALS FOR TRAINING OFFERINGS; AND 3) FORMALIZE SUPPLY CHAIN OFFERINGS FOR THE STATE?S GROWING MANUFACTURING SECTOR. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF NEVADA RENO AND THE STATE, THE CENTER IS FOCUSING ON ESTABLISHING AND SUSTAINING A SKILLED WORKFORCE PIPELINE, ORGANIZING THE MANUFACTURING SECTOR FOR A COMMON VOICE, PROMOTING ACCESS TO INDUSTRY-IDENTIFIED TECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION INCLUDING GOED?S KNOWLEDGE FUND, CONNECTING INDUSTRY TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT SUPPORTED BY GOED?S KNOWLEDGE FUND, REALIZING GROWTH IN EXPORTS THROUGH MANUFACTURING, IDENTIFYING AND ADDRESSING SUPPLY CHAIN GAPS FOR MANUFACTURERS, MARKETING FOR AWARENESS AND INCREASED ENROLLMENT IN SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATH (STEM) CAREERS AND EDUCATION, AND IMPLEMENTING LEARNING AND EARNING ADVANCED CAREER PATHWAYS (LEAP). THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE SUPPORTED BY NSHE PARTNERS AND THIRD PARTY EXPERTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: NEVADA INDUSTRY OF EXCELLENCE PLANS TO STRENGTHEN THEIR BUSINESS THROUGH INCREASING JOBS IN ADVANCED MANUFACTURING, FOOD MANUFACTURING, LOGISTICS, RENEWABLE ENERGY, AND UNMANNED SYSTEMS AND ADVANCED MOBILITY. ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL WORK TO ENSURE A HIGHLY SKILLED AND DIVERSE WORKFORCE BY EXPANDING AVAILABILITY OF STEM-FOCUSED CAREER PATHWAYS AND INCREASE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT REQUIRE INTERNSHIP/WORK EXPERIENCE COMPLETION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF NEVADA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  EFFECTIVE APRIL 1, 2022 VIA THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THIS RECIPIENT WAS GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE AN MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF KANSAS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF KANSAS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL, THE CENTER WILL ADDRESS WORKFORCE THAT ADDRESS PRODUCTIVITY AND BUSINESS PERFORMANCE ISSUES, CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT, AND COMPANY GROWTH FOR MANUFACTURERS AND IN MOST MANUFACTURING SECTORS IN THE STATE.  THE CENTER EXPECTS TO ADD AN INTERNAL WORKFORCE SOLUTIONS DELIVERY PROVIDER, TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE THESE CUSTOMIZED WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT SOLUTIONS.  THIS ROLE WILL ALSO MANAGE THE CREATION AND SUPPORT OF ADDITIONAL FEDERATION OF ADVANCED MANUFACTURING EDUCATION (FAME) CHAPTERS THROUGHOUT KANSAS. CENTER WILL LEAD THE DEVELOPMENT OF TWO ADDITIONAL CHAPTERS IN THE UPCOMING THREE-YEAR PLAN.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CENTER WILL STRENGTHEN MANUFACTURING IN KANSAS BY CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT, LEADERSHIP COACHING/STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT AND WORKFORCE SOLUTIONS. THE CENTER ALSO PLANS TO WORK WITH MORE FOOD MANUFACTURING COMPANIES TO DELIVER FOOD SAFETY RELATED PROJECTS. THE CENTER ALSO PLANS TO DRIVE MORE TECHNOLOGY AND AUTOMATION PROJECTS WITH COMPANIES. THIS IS SEEN AS AN OPPORTUNITY IN THE DATA AS COMPANIES REPORTED THAT THEY ARE STRUGGLING WITH ON-RAMPS TO AUTOMATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: KANSAS MEP SERVES SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED MANUFACTURING ENTITIES THROUGH ITS SIX CENTERS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF KANSAS. LOCATIONS INCLUDE LENEXA, CHANUTE, WICHITA, HUTCHINSON, GREAT BEND. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.THEY WILL ALSO FACILITATE THE TRANSFER OF TECHNOLOGY FROM THE PUBLIC SECTOR TO THE PRIVATE MANUFACTURING SECTOR WITH THE OVERALL GOAL OF GROWING CLIENT PROFITS AND GENERATING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES.

PURPOSE:  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT RECIPIENT WAS GRANTED FUNDING TO OPERATE AN MEP CENTER IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL, THE CENTER PLANS TO ACCELERATE GROWTH AND PROSPERITY IN NEW MEXICO BY FOCUSING ON FIVE CRITICAL AREAS WITH MANUFACTURERS; BUSINESS GROWTH, SUPPLIER DEVELOPMENT, CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT, TECHNOLOGY ACCELERATION, AND WORKFORCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CENTER WILL STRENGTHEN MANUFACTURING IN NEW MEXICO BY ACCELERATING ITS TRANSFORMATION TOWARD INNOVATION MAKING MANUFACTURERS A MORE EFFICIENT AND POWERFUL DRIVER OF ECONOMIC GROWTH AND JOB CREATION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.THEY WILL ALSO FACILITATE THE TRANSFER OF TECHNOLOGY FROM THE PUBLIC SECTOR TO THE PRIVATE MANUFACTURING SECTOR WITH THE OVERALL GOAL OF GROWING CLIENT PROFITS AND GENERATING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LEVEL, THE CENTER WILL WORK WITH MANUFACTURERS IN THE AREAS OF CYBER SECURITY, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, SUPPLY CHAIN, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, AND TRAINING.  THE CENTER WILL CONDUCT COMPETITIVENESS REVIEW ASSESSMENTS, OFFER CLASSROOM-BASED AND WEB-BASED TRAININGS SUCH AS STRATEGIC SOURCING, CYBERSECURITY, ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING, AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDE U.S. MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA ACCESS TO RESOURCES TO INCREASE PROFITABILITY, THROUGH NEW PROCESSES, SERVICES, CUSTOMERS, AND MARKETS. THE CENTER WILL ALSO HELP SOUTH CAROLINA MANUFACTURERS REMAIN COMPETITIVE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE MANUFACTURING EXTENSION SERVICES TO PRIMARILY SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THROUGH ITS COLLABORATIONS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LEVEL, AND INSTITUTES OF HIGHER EDUCATION, THE CENTER WILL WORK WITH MANUFACTURERS IN THE AREAS OF SUPPLIER SCOUTING, PRODUCT DESIGN, AUTOMATION, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND PLANNING, AND TRAINING.  THE CENTER WILL CONDUCT BUSINESS COMPETITIVE REVIEW ASSESSMENTS, ANALYSIS OF OPERATIONS, APPRENTICESHIP DESIGN. MMA CONTINUES THEIR FOCUS ON WORKPLACE AND WORKFORCE MODERNIZATION STRATEGIES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDE U.S. MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI ACCESS TO RESOURCES TO INCREASE PROFITABILITY, THROUGH NEW PRODUCTS, PROCESSES, SERVICES, CUSTOMERS, AND MARKETS. THE CENTER WILL ALSO HELP MANUFACTURERS REMAIN COMPETITIVE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED MANUFACTURERS IN THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO PARTICIPATE IN CONDUCTING THE ACTIVITIES OF THIS PROJECT TO INCLUDE AUTOMATION REVIEWS/ASSESSMENTS, SUPPLIER SCOUTING, PRODUCT DESIGN, MARKETING, AND TRAINING/CERTIFICATIONS.
